# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly.figure_factory as ff

import warnings
warnings.simplefilter(action='ignore', category=FutureWarning)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session
source.1fd95ad3:
#word cloud
from wordcloud import WordCloud, ImageColorGenerator
text = " ".join(str(each) for each in df.Name)
# Create and generate a word cloud image:
wordcloud = WordCloud(max_words=200,colormap='Set3', background_color="black").generate(text)
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.figure(figsize=(15,10))
# Display the generated image:
plt.imshow(wordcloud, interpolation='Bilinear')
plt.axis("off")
plt.figure(1,figsize=(12, 12))
plt.show

source.592f749f:
#Code by Anmol Prakash https://www.kaggle.com/anmolprakash121/india-travel-survey-eda

POY=pd.DataFrame(df["POY"].value_counts().reset_index(drop=False))

fig=px.pie(POY,values="POY",names=POY["index"],title="Magazine Covers from Person of the Year",
          color_discrete_sequence=["#556B2F","#8B0000"],width=450,height=450)

fig.show()
source.4307d719:
#Code by Anmol Prakash https://www.kaggle.com/anmolprakash121/india-travel-survey-eda

poy=pd.DataFrame(df["POY"].value_counts().reset_index().rename(columns={"index":"POY","POY":"count"}))

fig=px.bar(poy,x="count",y="POY",title="Person of the Year",color_discrete_sequence=['#8B008B'], text='count')

fig.update_xaxes(showgrid=False)

fig.update_yaxes(showgrid=False, categoryorder='total ascending', ticksuffix=' ', showline=False)

fig.update_traces(hovertemplate=None, marker=dict(line=dict(width=0)))

fig.update_layout(margin=dict(t=80, b=0, l=70, r=40),hovermode="y unified",
                  xaxis_title=' ', yaxis_title=" ", height=400,plot_bgcolor='white', paper_bgcolor='#333',
title_font=dict(size=25, color='white', family="Lato, sans-serif"),
font=dict(color='#8a8d93'),
                  legend=dict(orientation="h", yanchor="bottom", y=1, xanchor="center", x=0.5),
                  hoverlabel=dict(bgcolor="white", font_size=13, font_family="Lato, sans-serif"))
source.e2d5261c:
#Code by Anmol Prakash https://www.kaggle.com/anmolprakash121/india-travel-survey-eda

fig = px.bar(df,
               y    = 'POY',
               x    = "Occupation",
               orientation = 'v',
               color       = 'Occupation',
               hover_name  = 'Occupation',
               title       = 'Person of the Year Cover by Occupation',
               opacity     = 0.8,
               color_continuous_scale = px.colors.sequential.Viridis,
               height = 450
            )

fig.update_layout(showlegend=False)
fig.update_xaxes(title='Occupations')
fig.update_layout(margin=dict(t=80, b=0, l=70, r=40),hovermode="y unified",
                  xaxis_title=' ', yaxis_title=" ", height=450,plot_bgcolor='white', paper_bgcolor='white')

fig.update_yaxes(title='Person of the Year',showticklabels=False)
fig.show()
source.46902816:
#Code by Anmol Prakash https://www.kaggle.com/anmolprakash121/india-travel-survey-eda

trace=go.Bar(
x=df["Occupation"],
y=df["POY"],
marker=dict(color="rgb(120,50,800)",
           line=dict(color="rgb(200,210,220)",width=1.2)))



layout=go.Layout(template="plotly_dark",title="Person of the Year by Occupation:",xaxis=dict(title="Occupation",tickangle=45),yaxis=dict(title="Occupations"))
fig=go.Figure(data=[trace],layout=layout)
fig.show()






trace_second=go.Bar(
x=df["Occupation"],
y=df["Cover #"],
marker=dict(color="rgb(120,50,800)",
           line=dict(color="rgb(200,210,220)",width=1.2)))



layout=go.Layout(template="plotly_dark",title="Occupations by Cover#:",xaxis=dict(title="Occupation",tickangle=45),yaxis=dict(title="Occupations"))
fig=go.Figure(data=[trace_second],layout=layout)
fig.show()
